intro: Tristachya minuta, commonly known as the dwarf papyrus, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in wet or marshy environments, often growing near water bodies. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species in wetland ecosystems.
